content:
Hi All,

Da-Vinci-PCT-Ready-to-Vote-and-Apply-Tickets_02_02_2022.xlsx

As Promised, attached is a list of tickets that are Persuasive, not marked for "in person" and the core team feels are not controversial. (note two tabs) Therefore, we intend to move forward in the voting and applying to the IG process. There are 9 change requests and 13 technical corrections. Please reach out to @Vanessa Candelora with specific ticket numbers if you would like to discuss them. If you notify me by EOD Thursday (2/3) prior to our Friday at 11am ET open working call, I will add them to the agenda.

Next step for the Change Requests are to bring the block vote to FM.
Next step for the technical corrections are to apply the changes to the IG, no voting necessary.
Thank you.
@Larry Decelles @Gary Gryan @Rob Hausam @MaryKay McDaniel @Viet Nguyen @Denise St Clair, @Linda Michaelsen , @Celine A Lefebvre , @Corey Spears

Hello,

The attached items are submitted for a block vote for the Da Vinci PCT (Patient Cost Transparency) IG. These are all January 2022 Ballot Reconciliation tickets ready for FM vote based on the community consensus building process, which occurs on the open Friday PCT calls.

You may withdraw any item from the block vote by responding to this thread with the specific Key for the item you wish to withdraw. The Block vote is scheduled for the FM call on 3/8/2022 in the later 1 hour.

The following is a link to JIRA for block vote 1 which contains the same attached 30 ballot comments: https://jira.hl7.org/issues/?filter=16748

This is also emailed to the FM listserv.

Thank you

Da-Vinci-Patient-Cost-Transparency-STU1-Block-Vote-1.xlsx
